# react/prefer-es6-class <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

React offers you two ways to create traditional components: using the ES5
create-react-class module or the new ES6 class system.

### Why is this bad?

This rule enforces a consistent React class style.

### Example

```jsx
var Hello = createReactClass({
  render: function () {
    return <div>Hello {this.props.name}</div>;
  },
});
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny react/prefer-es6-class
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "react/prefer-es6-class": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
